data.title: A downtown favorite
data.text: I work downtown and eat here often.  My favorite is the seared tuna.  The curried chicken is also good.  It can be a very loud restaurant however when many people are dining.

data.title: Great way to relax
data.text: Great food! Burgers are outstanding! Super selection of craft beer, casual atmosphere and really nice when the weather is mild and you can sit outside!

data.title: Great Beer Selection
data.text: Had lunch and service was good, beer selections fantastic and food was OK.   Had the fish tacos, steak salad and crab cakes.   Crab cake was good with side salad and others were just OK.   Would go back for beer and try a burger.

data.title: Sweet potato fries are a must!
data.text: Very laid-back, service is always great, and the beer selection is great for San Angelo. The sweet potato fries are definitely the stand-out item to me! But everything is delicious in my opinion!

data.title: Great Beer, Great Food
data.text:
They have an awesome selection, including a few of their own brews. We enjoy trying new beers and while we don't love every one, we always find something we enjoy. 

The menu is diverse, which usually means a restaurant does a lot of things mediocre, instead of one thing well. But I have never had anything I didn't like.

data.title: Something For Everyone
data.text: This is one of our top 3 go to places in San Angelo.  The menu has a little of everything from ahi tuna, red curry, great sandwiches that can't be found anywhere else, and burgers.  The pulled pork sliders are awesome too.  It's in a great location downtown and reasonably priced.  This is where we take our of town guests for a meal because there truly is something for everyone on the menu.

data.title: You got to try the curry
data.text: Welcome to San Angelo!  great locally brewed beer and food.  The staff are all friendly and very courteous.

data.title: A Fun Place
data.text: Enjoyed dinner with a family group and found: Great Food & Service in a fun atmosphere.  Top that with a wide selection & very reasonable prices. Would definitely return on next trip.

data.title: Always love to eat here when in town
data.text: Really diverse menu - I love the ahi tuna meal - and no one has had a bad choice yet. The Mississippi mud cake is TO DIE FOR!  An absolute must share for the table after any meal.

data.title: Poor Planning
data.text: We had a huge business dinner there, I mean close to 50 people, and we had one waitress serving us all. Normally each table gets a waitress or there's at least help. Getting our drinks ordered and delivered took almost an hour alone. One of the guests at our table actually helped the waitress out. The food was good, but the service was extremely lacking. We made reservations, it wasn't like this was a surprise. I ran completely out of water and waited on everything from my drink to my check.

data.title: The place to go in San Angelo!!
data.text:
This place is over the top great!!
Nice cozy feeling when you first walk in. Service is awesome & bartender can help you decide exactly what beer your in the mood for. You can also choose a 5-pack of house brew samplers for $7.
Their burgers will give you that "oh wish I hadn't eaten all that" feeling! So excellent. Pretzel bun is very good.
Having lunch here really was the icing on our quick weekend trip!

data.title: I like this place
data.text:
In town on business. Had dinner here. 
Good selection of beer. Good menu selections. Had crab cake appetizer, 1 beer, fish tacos, and desert for about $25. 
Wait staff is a little slow, but they are busy. 
I'd recommend going here at least once if in town for business or leisure.

data.title: Good food & beer selection
data.text: Good food and choices to select from, cool little venue to meet up with friends. The cheddar blanket burger is my fave!! Probably not the healthy option by any means.............but it's delicious!!!!!!!!!!!!!

data.title: One Zero Zero Percent!
data.text: I really enjoy eating here. Great burgers (Cheddar Blanket Burger!) and tasty salads. Nice atmosphere; a chill place to enjoy a brew if you're looking to unwind. Check out their house brews and wide variety of ales.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: I had the fish and chips and it was excellent. Love the Tarter sauce. It wasn't that busy so we were served right away.

data.title: Nice choice of in-house brews
data.text: We were there on a Thursday night, so it wasn't very crowded/busy. The hostess noticed us & seated us immediately, the waiter arrived promptly & took our drink orders. Our meals arrived in very good timing with everything on the plate hot.  Bathrooms were easily found, clean, & neat; as was the entire customer area.  2-3 TVs in the place but none turned up too loud so as to be intrusive on conversation.  I had the fish tacos & thought they were very good.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: I had the tri-tip sandwich. It wasn't bad but was certainly not great. There was a very strong flavor that I couldn't identity that overwhelmed everything else. Fries were fine but nothing special. The price was right and I will try again but was a little disappointed.

data.title: Dinner
data.text: Went in for dinner place was busy so we sat at the bar. Waitstaff was friendly an knowledgeable on their large draft beer selection. Food was great an came quick will be returning again

data.title: Food and drinks
data.text: I like coming to the here because it's casual and can be dressy. I have a favorite drink but can't remember. The food and service has always been good. For small town San Angelo, this is a great start to a night downtown.

data.title: Cool beer & drink menu
data.text:
Their summer cocktail menu had several cool drinks on it. I had the jalapeño strawberry margarita, it was delicious.  They have a nice craft beer selection. 
We ordered the bbq chicken nachos and loved them!  We also shared the half chicken dinner, which was good as well. 
If visiting San Angelo again, we would return.
